intro: Pachycentria oligosperma, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, with simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces a capsule fruit containing numerous tiny seeds. Pachycentria oligosperma is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
